Saudi Arabia to see rain across multiple regions through December 31
description: Saudi Arabia is set to experience rainfall across several regions until 31 December, the National Centre for Meteorology has forecast. The expected showers coincide with a sharp drop in temperatures, signalling the onset of winter. Regions likely to be affected include Makkah, Asir, Al-Baha, Jazan, Madinah, Riyadh, Tabuk, Al-Jouf, the Eastern Province and the Northern Borders. Residents are advised to follow official updates.

What happens to human skin under space sunlight
description: Astronauts do not need sunscreen in space because their advanced spacesuits and spacecraft windows are designed to block harmful UV radiation. These engineered protections, rather than topical lotions, ensure safety from the Sun's harsh rays during extravehicular activities and inside habitats. A rare suit tear did cause one astronaut sunburn, highlighting the critical role of this technology.

He emphasized that despite the heated exchanges, mutual respect between players remained intact.

description: A horrific accident on NH-48 saw a fuel tanker collide with a sleeper bus, igniting a blaze that claimed at least nine lives. The tanker jumped the divider, engulfing the bus in flames and trapping passengers. Rescue efforts are ongoing, with the death toll expected to rise. The tanker driver perished, while some bus occupants escaped.

The facility is poised to become a major aviation hub, with plans for round-the-clock services and expanded capacity.

While AI may wipe out many traditional jobs, he believes it will also create thrilling, high-paying opportunities—some so futuristic they could involve space exploration. For today’s graduates, Altman says the timing couldn’t be better—they’re stepping into a career landscape unlike anything we’ve seen before.

Veteran politician Shashi Tharoor compared his talent to a young Sachin Tendulkar. Suryavanshi scored 190, holds multiple age-records across formats, and is being hailed as one of Indian cricket’s brightest future stars.

title: Christmas Throwback: When Football silenced guns — and stopped a World War
description: On Christmas Day in 1914, World War I briefly paused as British and German soldiers laid down their weapons, met in no man’s land, and played football. Known as the Christmas Truce, the moment saw enemies sing carols, exchange gifts, and share humanity. For a few hours, football replaced hatred and became a symbol of peace.

description: Navi Mumbai International Airport (NMIA) officially commenced commercial operations today, marking a significant expansion of air travel for the Mumbai region.  The airport will initially handle around 30 domestic flights daily, with IndiGo operating the first arrival and departure.  NMIA aims to scale up to round-the-clock services by February 2026.

title: Vaishnaw credits Make-in-India push for Bengaluru plant after Rahul Gandhi touts Karnataka ecosystem
description: The Union Minister thanked  the Congress leader for “acknowledging the success” of Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s Make-in-India programme.

title: Bangladesh unrest: Acted mute to save myself - Indian Tabla player recalls trauma
description: Indian musicians Mainak Biswas and Kallab Ghosh faced intense anxiety in Dhaka after their concert was cancelled.  Trapped for 48 hours amidst rising anti-Indian sentiment, Biswas described the experience as a "worst nightmare," highlighting the fear of being targeted as a Hindu in Bangladesh. They managed to return home on December 22nd.

description: A father's life is shattered after his five-year-old son survived a deadly cough syrup but lost his sight and mobility. The family incurred massive debts for his prolonged treatment, with government aid falling short. While authorities investigate, the father pleads for future medical support, hoping his child can one day see the world.

title: India test fires 3,500-km missile from nuclear submarine
description: India successfully tested its K-4 intermediate-range ballistic missile from the nuclear-powered submarine INS Arighaat in the Bay of Bengal. This solid-fuelled missile, capable of carrying a two-tonne nuclear payload, is crucial for strengthening the sea leg of India's nuclear weapons triad. The test marks a significant step towards enhancing India's strategic deterrence capabilities.

description: Parents are protesting a BJP leader's statement that appeared to justify an attack on a children's Christmas carol group. The leader claimed the group was drinking and took a band set. Parents stated the group comprised only children aged 10-15. An RSS worker was arrested. The incident occurred Sunday night. Police reported the accused was intoxicated.

title: Aravali hills row: Centre to increase mining-free zones amid protests
description: The Union environment ministry is expanding prohibited mining areas in the Aravali hills following Supreme Court directives and public protests. The ministry has asked a central institution to identify additional zones for mining bans, aiming to further protect the mountain range's ecology and biodiversity.

title: Delhi airport assault: Cops collect CCTV footage of pilot assaulting flyer
description: Police are investigating an alleged assault at Delhi airport. A passenger claims an Air India Express pilot assaulted him after he objected to staff jumping the security queue. CCTV footage has been collected and statements recorded. The airline has removed the pilot from duty pending an internal inquiry. An FIR has been registered.

title: Thackerays join hands for a Mumbai that has changed beyond recognition
description: The Thackeray cousins invoked their grandfather and social reformist ‘Prabodhankar’ Thackeray along with their respective fathers, to emphasise on the lineage of the family that had fought for the Marathi manoos, stressing on how this was under threat again

title: Yunus keen to improve ties with India, says adviser
description: Dhaka signals an effort to ease strain with New Delhi, stressing that economic decisions, including rice imports, will be driven by cost and national interest rather than politics

title: Discovery of a million more potential Epstein documents delays further releases
description: Releases so far have contained extensive redactions, angering ‌some Republicans and doing little to ‌defuse a scandal threatening the party ahead of the 2026 midterm ‍elections

title: T.N. Police Hackathon 2025 held in Chennai
'She deserved it': Bengaluru techie shoots wife point-blank; planned murder for months
description: A chillingly planned murder saw a bank manager shot dead by her estranged software engineer husband in Bengaluru. The accused, showing no remorse, confessed to the premeditated act, even carrying a knife as a backup. Suspicions of infidelity reportedly fueled the violence, with the victim's family also alleging abuse against their children.

title: ‘Blocked me, so I hit her’: Bengaluru woman says Instagram 'pal' turned violent after months of stalking; quit job, changed PG to escape
description: A 21-year-old woman in Bengaluru was allegedly stalked and assaulted by an Instagram acquaintance. The accused, 29-year-old Naveen Kumar N, reportedly harassed her after she rejected his advances. He intercepted her and her friend, assaulting her. Police arrested Naveen within 24 hours, registering a case under relevant sections of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita.

title: PM Modi to hold 3-day meet with chief secretaries, ease of business key agenda
description: Prime Minister Modi is convening a three-day summit with chief secretaries in Delhi to accelerate deregulation and enhance ease of business. The meeting will also focus on developing human capital to achieve India's developed nation status. Key themes include women and child welfare, education, sports, and skill development, with states presenting their initiatives.

title: NZ Tour of India: Spinner Lennox earns maiden call-up, Williamson to skip ODI series
description: Kane Williamson is unavailable for ODI selection due to his commitments in the SA20 league

title: Bengaluru: Man sets teen’s mom ablaze for refusing his marriage proposal
description: A 28-year-old tenant allegedly set a 45-year-old grocery shop owner ablaze after she refused his proposal to marry her daughter. The incident occurred in Basaveshwaranagar after the owner, Geeta, repeatedly rejected the suspect's advances. Geeta is in critical condition, and police are searching for the accused.

The incident involved a scuffle with a patient, and an FIR has been lodged.

description: Cambodia accused Thailand of destroying a Lord Vishnu statue in a disputed border area, amid renewed clashes that have killed over 40 and displaced nearly a million. Both sides blame each other for the violence, while diplomatic talks remain stalled.

Stock market holiday: Are NSE, BSE open for trading on December 25?
description: Stock markets will observe a Christmas holiday on December 25th, marking the year's final trading closure. Normal operations resume December 26th. Looking ahead to 2026, exchanges have unveiled a calendar featuring trading holidays, including Republic Day, Holi, and Diwali, with a special Muhurat Trading session planned.

title: Nvidia may have just admitted that it cannot take Amazon, Google & Microsoft in Cloud
description: Nvidia has shelved its ambitious plan to directly challenge cloud giants like Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure. The chipmaker is now refocusing its DGX Cloud division inward, prioritizing its own engineers' AI model development. This strategic pivot aims to protect Nvidia's dominant AI chip market share, estimated at over 80%, rather than pursuing cloud revenue.

title: Paul Rudd reacts to Travis Kelce’s emotional apology after Chiefs playoff loss
description: Actor Paul Rudd shared his perspective on the Kansas City Chiefs' season. He highlighted the joy and memories the team has provided his family. Rudd embraced the team's elimination from playoff contention. He wished Patrick Mahomes a speedy recovery. Rudd also humorously suggested players deserved a break after a long season. He stated he was not too upset.

title: Taylor Swift opens up about cancer scare and Travis Kelce’s support
description: Taylor Swift opened up about a painful chapter during the Eras Tour, revealing how a backup singer’s cancer diagnosis deeply shook her tour family. The experience marked an emotional low point, but Swift said she later found renewed joy and stability in her personal life, crediting Travis Kelce with bringing light and happiness after an incredibly difficult period.

title: Randi Mahomes hosts holiday giveaway as Patrick Mahomes battles injury
description: The Kansas City Chiefs are navigating a difficult season, and quarterback Patrick Mahomes is sidelined with a significant injury. Amid this challenging time, Patrick Mahomes' mother, Randi Mahomes, is focusing on a different mission which is to support families raising young athletes.

title: Salesforce reboots AI strategy: Model errors raise concerns
description: Salesforce is scaling back its reliance on large language models due to reliability issues, shifting focus to deterministic automation in its Agentforce product. Executives acknowledge a decline in trust in AI models, with reported instances of models omitting instructions and losing focus. This strategic pivot follows significant support staff reductions attributed to AI agent deployment.
